info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 6:07PM EDT until June 26 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh NC
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Alamance and Guilford.
* WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 607 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greensboro, McLeansville, Summerfield, Gibsonville, Monticello, Lake Townsend Marina, Lake Townsend, Lake Guilford Mackintosh Marina, Altamahaw, Altamahaw-Ossipee, Haw River State Park, Lake Jeanette Marina, Glen Raven, Lake Brandt, Lake Burlington and Lake Cammack Park & Marina. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING
